chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
vec_decomp_type: nat -> Type
vec_head_tail_type: forall n : nat, Vector.t X n -> Prop
vec_head_tail_prop: forall (n : nat) (v : Vector.t X n), vec_head_tail_type v
n: nat
v: Vector.t X n
q: pos n
p: pos n
x: X

Goal:
p <> q -> vec_pos (vec_change v p x) q = vec_pos v q

Premises:
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, pos (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
vec_change : forall n : nat, vec n -> pos n -> X -> vec n
Notation pos := Fin.t
Module Vector := Struct Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, t A n -> t A (S n) Definition t_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, t A n -> Type), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : t A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h ## t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : t A n), P n t. Definition t_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, t A n -> Prop), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : t A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h ## t)) ->
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
vec_pos : forall n : nat, vec n -> pos n -> X
vec_change_eq : forall (n : nat) (v : vec n) (p q : pos n) (x : X), p = q -> vec_pos (vec_change v p x) q = x
Bvector.BVxor : forall n : nat, Vector.t bool n -> Vector.t bool n -> Vector.t bool n
Bvector.BVand : forall n : nat, Vector.t bool n -> Vector.t bool n -> Vector.t bool n
Bvector.BVor : forall n : nat, Vector.t bool n -> Vector.t bool n -> Vector.t bool n
vec_pos_set : forall (n : nat) (g : pos n -> X) (p : pos n), vec_pos (vec_set_pos g) p = g p
Bvector.Bcons : bool -> forall n : nat, Vector.t bool n -> Vector.t bool (S n)
Bvector.Bneg : forall n : nat, Vector.t bool n -> Vector.t bool n
vec_pos_ext : forall (n : nat) (v w : vec n), (forall p : pos n, vec_pos v p = vec_pos w p) -> v = w
Bvector.Bhigh : forall n : nat, Vector.t bool (S n) -> Vector.t bool n
Fin.eq_dec : forall x0 y : pos ?n, {x0 = y} + {x0 <> y} where ?n : [X : Type vec_decomp_type := fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => Prop | S n0 => (X * vec n0)%type end : nat -> Type vec_head_tail_type := fun n : nat => match n as n0 return (vec n0 -> Prop) with | 0 => fun v : vec 0 => v = vec_nil | S n0 => fun v : vec (S n0) => v = vec_head v ## vec_tail v end : forall n : nat, vec n -> Prop vec_head_tail_prop : forall (n : nat) (v : vec n), vec_head_tail_type v n : nat v : vec n p : pos n q : pos n x : X |- nat]
